description.txt: 💅 CSS Grid
🎨  Explicit v. Implicit Grid
Source: https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example5/
The explicit grid is the template. The implict grid are rows and columns outside the template.

Explicit grid uses  grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns
Implicit grid uses grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns

kids.txt: Explicit grid uses  grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns
Implicit grid uses grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns

description.txt: Explicit Grid
When creating a CSS Grid we define the grid template for the columns, rows or areas we want with properties:
grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns, and grid-template-areas
e.g.
In CSS the template is refered to as the "explicit grid".
We can add more rows or columns outside of our template (say a third row, or third column).
This is refered to as the "implicit grid".
Implict Grid
The "implicit grid" is any rows or columns outside of the template (or "explicit grid").
To set the height or width of the implicit grid rows and columns we use

grid-auto-rows: 1fr 1fr; /* 2 rows, 1 fraction high each*/
grid-auto-columns: 1fr 1fr; /* 2 columns, 1 fraction wide each */

kids.txt:
grid-auto-rows: 1fr 1fr; /* 2 rows, 1 fraction high each*/
grid-auto-columns: 1fr 1fr; /* 2 columns, 1 fraction wide each */

description.txt: Auto Flow
By default, any extra grid items are added as a new row.
If we want to add extra grid items as a column we will use "grid-auto-flow" set to "column".
grid-auto-flow: column;
Summary
Explicit grid uses grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns.

kids.txt: Explicit grid uses grid-template-rows and grid-template-columns.

description.txt: Implicit grid uses grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns.

kids.txt: Implicit grid uses grid-auto-rows and grid-auto-columns.

description.txt: Add extra grid items to columns

kids.txt: Add extra grid items to columns

description.txt: grid-auto-flow: column;
💅 Grid Row and Column
🎨 Grid
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example2/
Let's have a look at how the grid is defined. The grid lines have rows and columns. These start at row 1, column 1  (not 0)
We can manually place items in the grid by defining the row start and end, and column start and end:

This starts at gridline row 1 and column 1 (top/left corner)
and ending at gridline row 2 and column 2 mking one square.
💅 Grid Row and Column Shorthand
🎨 Line-based placement shorthand - grid-row and grid-column
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example3/
We can achieve the same result as in example 2 using a shorthand syntax declaring the start and end values at once.
The values grid-row-start: 1 and grid-row-end: 2  can be shortened to  grid-row: 1 / 2
Values are separated with a /
Likewise the values grid-column-start: 1 and grid-column-end: 2  can be shortened to  grid-column: 1 / 2
We would be valid to omit the / and the end value as we are spanning only one track.

kids.txt: We would be valid to omit the / and the end value as we are spanning only one track.

description.txt: Summary
We can change

grid-row: 1 / 2;    /* 👉 start:1 end:2 */
grid-column: 2 / 3; /* 👉 start:2 end:3 */

kids.txt:
grid-row: 1 / 2;    /* 👉 start:1 end:2 */
grid-column: 2 / 3; /* 👉 start:2 end:3 */

template_data.title: Line based placement - Grid Row and Grid Column shorthand

description.txt: 💅 Grid Area Shorthand
🎨 Line-based placement shorthand with grid-area
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example4/

We can use the shorthand for grid-area to place an item on the gridlines with one line using
grid-area: row-start / col-start / row-end / col-end;
Line placement with grid-row and grid-column with start and end
Line placement with grid-row and grid-column

grid-row: 1 / 2;    /* 👉 start:1 end:2 */
grid-column: 2 / 3; /* 👉 start:2 end:3 */

kids.txt:
grid-row: 1 / 2;    /* 👉 start:1 end:2 */
grid-column: 2 / 3; /* 👉 start:2 end:3 */

description.txt: Line placement with grid-area
OR with grid-area we can simplify into one line
💅 CSS Grid - Line-based placement
🎨  spanning tracks
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example5/
To create Grid Areas that are larger than a single grid track we specify an end line that is more than one track away.
Here I am using the grid-column and grid-row shorthand and have omitted the end value for any items that span one row or column track.
Summary
By default spans one column if an end isn't specified
grid-column: 1 ; /* 👉 start:1 end:2 (start plus 1)*/
grid-column: 1 / 3; /* 👉 start:1 end:3 */

steps.title: Line-based placement spanning tracks with the span keyword

description.txt: 💅 CSS Grid - Line-based placement
🎨  span keyword
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example6/
We can also span using the span keyword. This example creates the same layout as the one in the previous example.
Let's use the span keyword rather than targeting the Grid Line by number.
I am also using the defaults for row and column end, which is to span 1.
Summary
The span tells how many columns to span starting the column-start gridline

/* "spans" two whole columns e.g. 1<--span-->2<--span-->3 */
grid-column: 1 / span 2; /* 👉 start:1 <-- span 2 cols --> end:3 (start plus 2)*/

kids.txt:
/* "spans" two whole columns e.g. 1<--span-->2<--span-->3 */
grid-column: 1 / span 2; /* 👉 start:1 <-- span 2 cols --> end:3 (start plus 2)*/

description.txt: we can span rows too
grid-row: 1 / span 3; /* 👉 start:1 <-- span 3 rows --> end:3 (start plus 3)*/

kids.txt: grid-row: 1 / span 3; /* 👉 start:1 <-- span 3 rows --> end:3 (start plus 3)*/

template_data.title: Line-based placement spanning tracks with the span keyword

description.txt: 💅 CSS Grid - Line-based placement
🎨  Line-based placement named lines
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example7/
We can name lines rather than targeting them by number. Name the line inside brackets.

To accomplish this we use the 
grid-template-columns
defining the column templates

or 
grid-template-rows defining our grid row template.
Columns
You can name the grid lines what ever you like
grid-template-columns: [col-line-1] 1fr [col-line2] 1fr [col-line-3];
A better approach is to use semantic names, for example:

300px           1fr              200px
  |-----------------|-----------------|----------|
sidebar-start    content-start    ads-start  ads-end
grid-template-columns: [sidebar-start] 300px [content-start] 1fr [ads-start] 200px [ads-end];
Placing content on the column template

We can now use these grid lines to place our content with 
grid-column
e.g.
grid-column: sidebar-start / ads-end; /* 👉 start:sidebar-start end:ads-end (inclusive)*/
Rows
You can name the grid lines what ever you like
grid-template-rows: [row-line-1] 1fr [row-line2] 1fr [row-line-3];
Placing content on the row template

We can now use these grid lines to place our content with 
grid-row
e.g.
grid-row: row-line-1 / row-line-3; /* 👉 start:row-line-1 end:row-line-3 (inclusive)*/
Summary
Define the template gridline names

grid-template-columns: [col-line-1] 1fr [col-line2] 1fr [col-line-3];
grid-template-rows: [row-line-1] 1fr [row-line2] 1fr [row-line-3];
Place your content on the grid

grid-column: sidebar-start / ads-end; /* 👉 start:sidebar-start end:ads-end (inclusive)*/
grid-row: row-line-1 / row-line-3; /* 👉 start:row-line-1 end:row-line-3 (inclusive)*/

kids.txt:
grid-column: sidebar-start / ads-end; /* 👉 start:sidebar-start end:ads-end (inclusive)*/
grid-row: row-line-1 / row-line-3; /* 👉 start:row-line-1 end:row-line-3 (inclusive)*/

steps.title: Line-based placement named lines with spans

description.txt: 💅 CSS Grid - Line-based placement
🎨  Line-based placement named lines with spans
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example8/
You can give lines the same name and then use the span keyword to target lines of a certain name.
This is really useful if you want to create a complex grid with multiple content tracks and gutters.

I have made a slightly larger grid here and have named all of the Grid Lines before the content tracks with col and all of the lines before the row tracks with row. I can then start at a certain column line by using col  <line number> and span by saying span  <number of lines>.

kids.txt: I have made a slightly larger grid here and have named all of the Grid Lines before the content tracks with col and all of the lines before the row tracks with row. I can then start at a certain column line by using col

description.txt: Summary
Define your grid template

grid-template-columns: [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr;
grid-template-rows: [row-name] auto [row-name] auto [row-name];
Place your content on the grid

grid-column: col-name 2 / span 3 ; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 3 cols --> end: 5 (2 plus 3) */
grid-row: row 2 / span 2; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 2 --> end: 4 (2 plus 2) */

kids.txt:
grid-column: col-name 2 / span 3 ; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 3 cols --> end: 5 (2 plus 3) */
grid-row: row 2 / span 2; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 2 --> end: 4 (2 plus 2) */

description.txt: If an span (or -end) is not specified it defaults to 1 span.

grid-column: col-name 2 ; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 1 cols --> end: 3 (2 plus 1) */
grid-row: row 2; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 1 row by default --> end: 3 (2 plus 1) */

kids.txt:
grid-column: col-name 2 ; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 1 cols --> end: 3 (2 plus 1) */
grid-row: row 2; /* 👉 start: 2 <-- span 1 row by default --> end: 3 (2 plus 1) */

template_data.title: Line-based placement named lines with spans

description.txt: 💅 CSS Grid - Auto placement
🎨  Source
Source https://gridbyexample.com/examples/example9/
👾 repeat()
We can repeat columns using the repeat keyword.

kids.txt: We can repeat columns using the

description.txt: Let's create 10 columns with the name "col-name". We will make each column 1fr wide.
❌ without repeat()
grid-template-columns: [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr [col-name] 1fr;
✅ with repeat()
We can use the keyword repeat instead.

/**
 * @param numberOfTimes - the number of times to repeat
 * @param optionalColumnName - the optional column name
 * @param width - width e.g. 1 fraction, %, px, vw, em or rem 
 */
repeat(numberOfTimes, [optionalColumnName] width)

kids.txt:
/**
 * @param numberOfTimes - the number of times to repeat
 * @param optionalColumnName - the optional column name
 * @param width - width e.g. 1 fraction, %, px, vw, em or rem 
 */
repeat(numberOfTimes, [optionalColumnName] width)

description.txt:
grid-template-columns: repeat(10, [col-name] 1fr)
```
* Repeat 10 times
* Column name is "col-name". this can be anything.
* width of 1 fraction each column. This is will split the parents width into 10 fractions (the equivalent of 10% width) 

We can omit the column name too

kids.txt:
grid-template-columns: repeat(10, [col-name] 1fr)
```
* Repeat 10 times
* Column name is "col-name". this can be anything.
* width of 1 fraction each column. This is will split the parents width into 10 fractions (the equivalent of 10% width) 

We can omit the column name too

description.txt:
css
grid-template-columns: repeat(10, 1fr)

###### Grid Item Placement
We can use the column names to target the column gridline

kids.txt:
###### Grid Item Placement
We can use the column names to target the column gridline

description.txt:
css
grid-column: col-name 1 / span 3; /* 👉 start:1 end:4 /
grid-row: row-name 2 / span 2; / 👉 start:2 end:4 */

Here we place the item on column:
* column gridline 1 (far left) 
* span 2 whole columns
* the end gridline is 3 (1 + 2)

Here we place the item on row:
* row  gridline 2 
* span 2 whole rows
* the end gridline is 4 (2 + 2)



if a span is not specified it defaults to 1
